tokenvisibility.settings.range-algorithm:
How to test whether a token is within range of another. Also controls number of points for line-of-sight points algorithm. Algorithms sorted from least to most performance-intensive.
See https://github.com/caewok/fvtt-token-visibility#settings for a full explanation.
tokenvisibility.settings.los-algorithm.H:
How to test a token's line-of-sight to another.
Points will use the points from Range Algorithm. Area is generally more performance-intensive, but not always.\nSee https://github.com/caewok/fvtt-token-visibility#settings for a full explanation.
tokenvisibility.settings.los-percent-are: Percentage of the token hit area that must be viewable to another token to be considered visible by that other token. If set to 0, then if any part of the token is viewable, it is considered visible.
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-algorithm:
How to test whether a token has cover in relation to another.
Algorithms loosely sorted from least to most performance-intensive.
See https://github.com/caewok/fvtt-token-visibility#settings for a full explanation.
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-center-to: Center to corners of select target square
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-corner-to: Corner to corners of select target square (dnd5e DMG)
Name of low cover displayed to users.
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-name-medi: Name of medium cover displayed to users.
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-name-high: Name of high cover displayed to users.
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-effect-lo: Name of the active effect to add to a token with low cover. Leave blank for none.
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-effect-me: Name of the active effect to add to a token with medium cover. Leave blank for none.
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-effect-hi: Name of the active effect to add to the token with high cover. Leave blank for none.
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-trigger-p: If less than this percent of the corners or token area (depending on algorithm) is viewable, the token will have low cover.
If less than this percent of the corners or token area (depending on algorithm) is viewable, the token will have medium cover.
If less than this percent of the corner or token area (depending on algorithm) is viewable, the token will have high cover.
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-trigger-c: When the line from one token center to another token center is blocked, use this cover type. (PF2e uses Medium, or Standard, cover.)
tokenvisibility.settings.midiqol-coverch: When using midi-qol for attacks, should cover be applied automatically or require a confirmation dialog from the GM or user?
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-combat-au: If in combat, when a user that owns the current combatant is targeting a token, apply cover effects to the targeted token based on cover from the current combatant.
tokenvisibility.settings.cover-chat-mess: When rolling an attack, test and display cover for targets in the chat. Currently only in dnd5e.
